nodes.text: @markchappelle @GeorgeMichael Let me go and give this a stream for its 25th anniversary. https://t.co/M2LcazNBBi
@travisfromthebk That video was dope.

April 22, 1996: @GeorgeMichael releases "Fastlove." The United States was one of few places in the world where the song wasn't #1.\n\nFor the record, it samples Patrice Rushen's "Forget Me Nots," so for 3 of its 4 writers, "Fastlove" should qualify as a Black-owned business. 😉 https://t.co/cK5y4Hm6jk
@marramark Make the case for it! https://t.co/Hk6bYmnDqs

@markchappelle Most of the songs shed his maximalist ‘Faith’ persona with breathing room. Covers Stevie Wonder. Works the Stones into a song. Ends with a longing reprise. Like PSBoys ‘Behaviour’ it’s lightly imbued with weighty self examination hued by the AIDS crisis in the late 80s/early 90s.
@TheQHBlend @paisleysparks44 @markchappelle Uh ... “lost”?

@marramark @paisleysparks44 @markchappelle And here I thought I was being diplomatic lol. But yes, I think Madonna is very lost right now. She has the skill set, but she is caught in this social media thing and her own fear of aging. I think it has stunted her creative muse imho.
@paisleysparks44 @markchappelle @marramark I enjoy that material too. But her albums game hits the ground running with “Bedtime Stories” (sorry to my Madge Mark lol).
@TheQHBlend @markchappelle @marramark I did give Bedtime a spin or two back at release.
@TheQHBlend @markchappelle @marramark I can actually get to grips with her pre-Erotica era. Singles wise at least! I always exaggerate my feelings towards her.
@paisleysparks44 @markchappelle @marramark Madonna has a lot to offer despite her being lost these days.
@markchappelle @TheQHBlend omg u need to dip into this immediately

@paisleysparks44 @markchappelle @marramark Don’t close yourself off to new experiences my friend. That’s all I’ll say. It’s one thing to give it a go and know that it isn’t for you. I think her material from 1994 through to 2003 would appeal to you. Food for thought.
@TheQHBlend @markchappelle @marramark I love you Quentin but I fear we may always find Madonna a step too far 😉

@marramark @TheQHBlend I dig select George Michael singles. I've never consumed full George Michael albums! (It's pretty much how I feel about Madonna, just without the contempt I have for her public persona.)

@markchappelle @marramark @TheQHBlend I, too was a GM take or leave kind of fella but I’ve grown to like him more and more. I’ll be honest and say his political leanings and charity work that went unreported during his life helped me. He was a remarkable chap. I’m et to get there with Madonna . . .

@markchappelle @GeorgeMichael I’ve been a GM fan since Wham. Older is a great album. I didn’t appreciate it until I got older 😆\nFastlove was one of many jams on Older. I think the US was stuck on the GM from Wham and Faith.
@markchappelle @marramark You should take the jump. LWP is in my Top 20 albums of all-time.
@markchappelle @GeorgeMichael Yes it should! Love that song 🙌🏽
@markchappelle @TheQHBlend So you've never spun 'Listen Without Prejudice'?
@headphoneaddict @GeorgeMichael I feel like @TheQHBlend may have written about it at length. I haven't made the jump into George Michael's larger catalog, but I know who to consult before I do.
@markchappelle @headphoneaddict In a manner, yes. Here. https://t.co/m7ZJsMwsD8

@markchappelle @GeorgeMichael "Fastlove" was my joint. It was on VH1 every damn day back then. His "Older" album needs a reappraisal in the USA. It's a super mature album with nuanced & dynamic songwriting and production.
